p: In the evaluation of the antioxidant potential of the twelve selected populations, “S” showed the most significant antiradical capacity, with EC 50 = 7.76 ± 0.3 µg/mL and 6.51 ± 0.63 mmol TE/g measured by DPPH and ORAC assays, respectively. However, the extracts showed lower activity compared to ascorbic acid (EC 50 = 0.3 ± 0.02 µg/mL) in the DPPH and rutin (20.22 ± 0.63 mmol TE/g) and EGCG (11.97 ± 0.02 mmol TE/g) in the ORAC assay ( Figure 6 and Figure 7).
